revised_title: Analysis of Ancient Metallic Arms and Utensils: Composition and Origin
tldr: The author examines ancient metallic arms and utensils found in rivers, analyzing their composition and origin. The artifacts, including Roman swords and British tools, were made of brass and iron, with some believed to be steel. The author also discusses the possible uses and techniques used in their creation, providing insights into the craftsmanship and materials of the time.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
